_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The principle for giving up the all [sn3: The eye should be given up.
Eye consciousness should be given up.
Eye contact should be given up.
The painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by eye contact should also be given up.
The ear … nose … tongue … body … mind sh: The ear should be given up.
Sounds should be given up.
Ear consciousness should be given up.
Ear contact should be given up.
The painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by ear contact should also be given up.
The nose should be given up.
Smells should be given up.
Nose consciousness should be given up.
Nose contact should be given up.
The painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by nose contact should also be given up.
The tongue should be given up.
Tastes should be given up.
Tongue consciousness should be given up.
Tongue contact should be given up.
The painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by tongue contact should also be given up.
The body should be given up.
Touch should be given up.
Body consciousness should be given up.
Body contact should be given up.
The painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by body contact should also be given up.
The mind should be given up.
Thoughts should be given up.
Mind consciousness should be given up.
Mind contact should be given up.
The painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by mind contact should be given up.
